Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Forest Preserves of Cook County within the Office of the President
Description: Community conservation projects in local forest preserves
Detail Description: The Forest Preserves along with corps partners will recruit and hire up to 282 adult corps members per year from Cook County who are currently unemployed or under-employed to conduct meaningful conservation work in their local Forest Preserve. Corps members will be deployed in teams of 6 to 10 participants and supervised by experienced Field Leaders who have the technical skills to train and supervise conservation work while providing soft job skills for those new to the work force. A minimum of 75% of participants will gain at least three advanced industry skill certifications.

Agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Description: Funds for establishing, expanding, and sustaining public health workforces
Detail Description: These funds can be used to carry out activities related to establishing, expanding, and sustaining a public health workforce employed by state or local public health departments or non-profit, private, or public organizations with demonstrated expertise in implementing public health programs. Public health departments employ contact tracers, nurses, epidemiologists, community health workers.
source_name: CDC Disease Intervention Specialists Workforce Development Funding

Agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Description: Funds for establishing, expanding, and sustaining public health workforces
Detail Description: These funds can be used to carry out activities related to establishing, expanding, and sustaining a public health workforce employed by state or local public health departments or non-profit, private, or public organizations with demonstrated expertise in implementing public health programs. Public health departments employ contact tracers, nurses, epidemiologists, community health workers
source_name: CDC Disease Intervention Specialists Workforce Development Funding

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development
Description: Workforce developpment and community service programming in suburban Cook County
Detail Description: Cook County will provide support to workforce and training programs that offer young adults quality paid work experiences to explore career pathways in target sectors or provide opportunities for a “community service corps”. The County will also support the expansion of workforce development programs that serve hard to engage populations including people without stable housing, youth in care and graduates of foster care system, people with disabilities, returning residents, and pregnant and parenting youth. Program resources will support residents of suburban Cook County.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
Description: Expands workforce training opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals
Detail Description: Expands workforce training opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals to attain employment and other stabilization services
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Department of Planning and Development; Department of Business Affiairs and Consumer Protection
Detail Description: Creates workforce opportunities for engagement along corridors to ensure safety, cleanliness, and local participation in commercial development processes
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development
Detail Description: As a designated Apprenticeship Navigator by the Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity, Cook County will support the establishment of new apprenticeships or expansions of existing apprenticeships in suburban Cook County. The Bureau of Economic Development will fund eligible partners and Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity intermediaries to sponsor and manage apprenticeship programs, conduct industry engagement, provide technical assistance to businesses, and support apprentices' progress.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
Description: Workforce development programming and wraparound services
Detail Description: Provides workforce development programming, including apprenticeship, career services, and other wraparound support for those entering the workforce or new industries
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
Description: Workforce programs for displaced wokers and underrepresented populations
Detail Description: Connects displaced workers, with an emphasis on underrepresented populations, with new opportunities and reinvigorated efforts to reach unemployed and underemployed populations at all skill levels
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
Description: Creates and expands youth career programs
Detail Description: Creates and expands a comprehensive portfolio of programs to connect Chicago youth with early career opportunities, as well as an expansion of the My CHI. My Future. Program to increase opportunities for out-of-school programming and education
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan
